topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5365be876368725916c10000#post_5365be876368725916c10000
Militaristically(okay what is wrong with my spellcheck; it's counting that as misspelled) speaking this couldn't have come at a better time for the loyalists.  Better for separatists to claim war early on when they only have a small portion of the country and be recognized as terrorists internationally than later on when they have most control of the country.

Easier to drum up support to help Ukraine against "terrorists" than it is to drum up support against "freedom fighters".  While semantically speaking they're the same thing it is still easier to get people to support putting boots on the ground to fight "terrorists".

So no WWIII or Cold War 2 just a eastern europe expansion into the "War on Terror".

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5365c00763687220a1060000#post_5365c00763687220a1060000
[bq="someguy111"]Does anyone here know how to increase your PC's RAM when you have already reached the limit? Let's say you have 4 slots and each has an 8gig stick which is the highest amount desktop RAM will go and thus have 32 GB. Instead of having to buy a CPU with quad channel memory and a board with 8 slots, is there a way you can add more RAM? I heard about a RAM expander card that can be used via pci but those are from way back and I din't think would work with a modern board or CPU plus it's only DDR which means even with 4 slots it's only a 4gig increase. I don't want to buy server RAM because it's expense and of course needs a server CPU and board to use it.[/bq]
You should have asked this in the computer general thread, but like you said server ram wouldn't work on your computer.  Also yes you can buy a RAM expander, but I don't think there is a DDR3 type ram expander.

Short version: No
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5365c25b63687244781d0000#post_5365c25b63687244781d0000
http://derpibooru.org/dis/computers-generalhelp-advice-talk
I covered most of the basics off the bat with a couple long posts so that 95% of the thread wouldn't be, "How do I reduce my ram usage?" or "My computer won't turn on" or such.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5365c07f63687214a46d0000#post_5365c07f63687214a46d0000
As much as I respect Russians. I'd say the Varenikis should make a strong stance for the sake of their sovereignty. This conflict is just unnecessary. And it will bring unwanted consequences to both the Ukrainian and the Russian people if they don't make a quick resolve.
 Like what Sun Tzu said, "No long war ever profited any country: 100 victories in 100 battles is simply ridiculous. Anyone who excels in defeating his enemies triumphs before his enemy's threats become real".

!http://www.russianseason.net/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/vareniki3.jpg!
